title: Understanding Ceramic Capacitors
excerpt: A comprehensive guide to ceramic capacitors: types, applications, and selection criteria.
content:
Understanding Ceramic Capacitors

Ceramic capacitors are one of the most widely used types of capacitors in modern electronics. Their popularity stems from their small size, low cost, and excellent performance characteristics.

Types of Ceramic Capacitors

Ceramic capacitors are classified into two main categories:

  • Class I: Temperature stable, used in precision circuits
  • Class II: High capacitance density, used in general applications

Selection Criteria

When selecting ceramic capacitors, consider:

  • Capacitance value and tolerance
  • Voltage rating
  • Dielectric material (X7R, Y5V, etc.)
  • Operating temperature range
  • Package size

title: MLCC vs. Radial Capacitors: Which Should You Choose?
excerpt: Comparing multilayer ceramic capacitors and traditional radial capacitors.
content:
MLCC vs. Radial Capacitors

Both MLCC and radial ceramic capacitors have their place in modern electronics design. Let's explore the differences.

Size and Space Efficiency

MLCC capacitors are significantly smaller than radial capacitors, making them ideal for compact PCB designs.

Cost Considerations

MLCC capacitors typically offer better cost-per-capacitance ratios, especially in high-volume production.

Performance Characteristics

While MLCC capacitors excel in most applications, radial capacitors still offer advantages in certain specialty applications where larger values are required.
